meanings.sent1: She was relucting to try the new food.
meanings.sent2: The child kept relucting to go to bed.
meanings.sent3: Even though she was hungry, she was relucting to eat the strange-looking dish.
meanings.sent4: His feet were relucting to move, as if glued to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The dog was relucting to enter the water, afraid of getting wet.

meanings.sent1: The protestors were relucting the new law.
meanings.sent2: He was relucting the idea of going on a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent3: The cat was relucting the idea of taking a bath, meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The tree was relucting the strong winds, standing tall and unmoved.
meanings.sent5: The student was relucting the teacher's instructions, wanting to do it their own way.

meanings.sent1: She was relucting to join the dance class.
meanings.sent2: He kept relucting to speak in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was relucting to come down from the tree, peeking nervously.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were relucting to part, keeping the sun hidden.
meanings.sent5: The child was relucting to share the toy, holding it tightly.
